Need to work or have fun together and see each other on the map in real time? Teams of hunters, field workers, parents/children, drivers, hikers and responders may find this app useful for coordinating their location related activities.

► Invite members.
Members are invited with a simple code. No registration or sign up is required.

► Control location sharing/tracking.
Your location only leaves your iPhone or iPad when you enable team tracking in the app.
• When team tracking is ON:
 1. Your location is sent to the server and shared with your team members. 
 2. App stays working in the background and continues to share your location with team members (via server) even if it is not visible on a screen.
• When team tracking is OFF:
 1. Your location data will not leave your phone and is not shared in any way.
 2. App is removed from memory when it is not visible on a screen.

► Members on the map.
By default map follows your own location. Tap on a member row and pick "Center on map" to have map centered on the member's location.

► Navigate to a moving team member. 
Tap on a member row, pick "Set as target". The app will show a line between you and the team member, so you can see the course to take to the member, even if they move. To show your own course line, hold your finger on the map and pick "Show course line".

► Member alerts.
Add polygonal or circular zones and setup alerts for team members leaving or entering.
Alerts for member's speed being below or above some threshold.
Alerts for distance between you and team members.

► Status and messages.
Members can set up their own statuses and apply them with 2 taps to make others aware of their status.
If short status is not enough, members can type in a message to share within the team.

► Customizable map corner panels.
Your own or member data can be shown, like:
Speed, altitude, coordinates (Lat/Long, UTM or MGRS).
Distance between yourself/member and a waypoint, or between two members.

► Battery impact.
- When you have team tracking OFF, the app is completely removed from memory when it is not visible on the screen and doesn't consume battery or GPS.
- When team tracking is ON, the app will use GPS and will keep sending data to the server whether it is visible on the screen or not. This implies higher battery consumption than usual. 
By default, your location is synchronized with the server/team every 5 seconds. You can change this in the app settings > Team synchronization to a slower sync interval and save both battery and data.

▼ Free version limitations:
Number of team members is limited.
Maximum of 2 zones/overlays.
Synchronization interval is limited to 5 seconds or slower.
GPS Beacon history is limited to 4 hours.

Free version covers you going with your child/friend for a hike and following each other. Or following a teen driver, including speed alerts.

No limits on member or zone count.
Synchronization frequency of up to 1 per second.
GPS Beacon history up to 24 hours.

Huntloc is a real-time hunting, tracking and management app for hunting teams and provides tracking devices for hunting dogs. You can see the movement of hunting dogs and other hunters on your smartphone, share information between hunters and create your own hunting map.

Tracking a common hunt is easy
One of the members of the hunt starts hunting on his or her phone and receives a unique code. Other hunters join the hunt using this code. This creates a hunting team whose movement is visible on the phone map. When the owner of a hunting dog with a Huntloc tracking device joins the hunt, all participants will also be able to see the dog's location. 
Hunting with Huntloc is more effective, safer and more fun
•	While on a common hunt, your phone shows the current location of dogs and hunters, the direction of movement, the pace of movement, and the distance traveled. Hunting and dog tracking are unlimited in distance.
•	During the hunt, you can send messages to the participants and share the location of the various hunting events on the map (e.g., a caught game, an animal track, etc.). Plus, you can quickly call any hunter.
•	The different maps of Google and the Estonian Land Board and the hunting objects recorded by the hunter themselves (e.g., animal feeding places and other hunting-related locations and areas) give an accurate overview of the hunting ground. You can share your hunting objects with other Huntloc users. 
•	When navigating in the hunt, you can set a navigation target and then use the compass view to arrive at the desired location by the shortest route.
•	A 24-hour weather forecast with sunrise and sunset time will help you plan your hunt. You can view the weather forecast for your own location or for a location selected on the map.
•	Huntloc's portal.huntloc.com can be used for viewing the hunts you have participated in and for more convenient drawing of the hunting card.

The location of a dog with the Huntloc tracking device can be seen on your smartphone
The Huntloc tracking device provides a very accurate position of the dog in the terrain. The tracking device uses the mobile network and has no distance limitation - the dog can be tracked from thousands of kilometers away. All you need is a smartphone to monitor your dog and control your device. In addition to tracking, you can call the dog, listen to the dog's activities and give voice commands. Keeping the device constantly on the dog's neck, it acts as a security device and can be switched on from a distance when the dog is lost. 

The tracking device is very strong, lightweight, waterproof and has a long service life. The monitoring time is 36 hours (10 seconds interval) and the standby time is 1 month. In order to ensure waterproofing, there are no openings or buttons on the unit, and the 3 indicator lights indicate the unit's operating status. The device is charged wirelessly.
